items.message:
Areas most at risk include low lying areas in Tetbury, Badminton, Brook End at Luckington, Corsham, Lacock and the road at Reybridge.
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon, Dauntsey Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around Areas most at risk include low lying areas in Tetbury, Badminton, Brook End at Luckington, Corsham, Lacock and the road at Reybridge.
Weather conditions have generally improved and rainfall levels are low for the next few days through until Friday when the next weather system arrives. Whilst there is an improving picture with river levels starting to reduce, levels are still high.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 18:00 03 Dec 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Yeo and River Parrett Moors around Muchelney and Thorney
items.message:
Rising river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 02 December 2025 . 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. The River Yeo level at Huish Episcopi pumping station is 8.88m and rising. The drain level at Huish Episcopi pumping station is 6.88m and rising. Showers are expected with significant rain forecast on 05 December. 
Flooding will affect the road from Langport to Muchelney if this drain level exceeds 7.3m; the road from Muchelney to Long Load above 7.86m; the road from Muchelney to Thorney above 7.93m and the road from Muchelney to Draycott above 8.8m. Property flooding is possible above 8.35m. Allermoor spillway is running. 
We are closely monitoring the situation and clearing blockages from debris screens. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water and refer to local authority website for road closures. 
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 03 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
High river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible during Tuesday 02 December. 
River levels remain high in response to yesterday's rainfall.
Forecast levels may cause flooding to low lying land and roads close to the rivers. The main areas of concern are Cullompton, Willand, Culmstock, Hemyock, Bradninch, Broadclyst and Clyst St Mary.

We expect the rivers levels to start falling, during the remainder of the day. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 03 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels are currently rising due to rainfall on Monday, subsequently flooding may continue over the next few days. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the River Severn from Tewkesbury to Gloucester. Locations that may be affected include Apperley, Maisemore, Hempstead, Minsterworth Ham and Quedgeley. The Severn Ham, Tewkesbury may start to fill.  

Predicted peaks:-  
Mythe 3.1m to 3.7m 05/12/2025 PM. 
Haw Bridge 4.0m to 4.7m 05/12/2025 PM. 

Tides are increasing from Wednesday until the weekend. River levels at Sandhurst and Gloucester will be influenced by these tides. Current predictions: 

Sandhurst 2.9m to 3.1m 03/12/2025 PM and 3.0m to 3.2m 04/12/2025 AM.  
Gloucester 2.5m to 2.8m 03/12/2025 PM and 2.8m to 3.1m 04/12/2025 AM. 

We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.   
This message will be updated by 09:00AM on 4 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

River levels have peaked and have started to fall at all river gauges. Flooding continues today 03 December 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads along the River Wye from Hay on Wye to Ross on Wye. Other locations affected may include the A438 between Letton & Willersey, Byford, Bredwardine & Hereford. Road closures & diversions on the A438 may be in force. 

Observed peaks:- Hay on Wye peaked at 2.45m at 3am on 02/12/25, Bredwardine peaked at 4.41m at 8am on 02/12/25,.Belmont peaked at 4.43m at 1pm on 02/12/25, Old Wye Bridge peaked at 3.84m a 1pm on 02/12/25, Mordiford peaked at 4.23m at 5:15pm on 02/12/25, Ross on Wye peaked at 3.55m at midnight on 02/12/25  We are closely monitoring the situation . items.description: River Dee catchment in England from Whitchurch to Chester
items.message:
River levels are slowly rising and are due to peak by midday tomorrow, 03 December 2025. River levels will then begin to fall after this time.

Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Dee. Flooding is possible at low lying land and roads around the River Dee at Shocklach, Farndon, Handley, Lower Kinnerton, Chester and Puddington. 

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and are checking rivers for blockages in the area. 

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. 

This message will be updated by 16:00PM on 03 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels are currently rising due to rainfall on Monday, subsequently flooding may continue over the next few days. 
Flooding may affect low lying land & roads adjacent to the river from Highley to Tewkesbury; including Dog Lane Bewdley, Stourport, Diglis & Hylton Road towpath. Flooded drains may affect the racecourse & Worcester CCG. PLP should be installed. New St and Waterside Gates are closed at Upton upon Severn.   

Predicted peaks:- 
Bewdley 3.0m to 3.8 m 04/12/2025 PM. 
Worcester 3.4m to 4.1m 04/12/2025 OVERNIGHT. 
Diglis 3.0m to 3.7m 05/12/2025 AM. 
Kempsey Yacht Club 5.0m to 5.7m 05/12/25 AM. 
Saxons Lode 4.1m to 4.7m 05/12/25 PM. 

We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  Consider the installation of property flood resilience measures 

This message will be updated by 09:00AM on 4 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels are currently rising due to rainfall on Monday, subsequently flooding may continue over the next few days. 
Flooding may affect low lying land and Squires Walk in the area of the Hatfield Brook Kempsey.  

Kempsey Flood Alleviation Scheme may become operational from 03/12/2025 AM. 

Predicted peak:-  
Kempsey Yacht Club 5.0m to 5.7m 05/12/25 AM.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message:
River and Lake levels remain high following recent heavy rainfall. Further scattered showers are expected today, Wednesday 3/12/2025 some heavy, which will keep river and lake levels elevated.

We continue to monitor the situation.

This message will be updated by 09:00AM on Wednesday 04 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

The flood forecast has changed significantly. As a result, there is no longer a risk of flooding in the area. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

items.description: River Parrett (upper) from South Perrott to Thorney
items.message:
The Flood Warning has now been removed. However, a Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area, so flooding of roads and low lying land is still possible. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

items.description: River Ouse at York - riverside properties
items.message: High river levels are expected to cause flooding today, Wednesday 03 December 2025. Locations most affected will be properties on King's Staith in York and riverside areas through York from Lendal Bridge to Millennium Bridge. The Foss Barrier is operating and riverside flood gates in York have been closed. River levels have peaked and are falling. We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. This message will be updated by  04:00PM on 03 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, Kingston upon Hull
floodArea.riverOrSea: Winestead Drain, Holderness Drain, Burstwick Drain, Skeffling Drain, Long Bank Drain, Keyingham Drain, Old Fleet Drain, Kellwell Stream, Lambwath Stream

items.message: High river levels are expected to cause flooding tonight and into Wednesday 03/12/25. Holderness Drain area including Leven and Bransholme. The forecast remains unsettled this week. We are closely monitoring the situation and have pumps in operation in the area. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 11AM on 03 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Foulness and Market Weighton catchment

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Foulness, Market Weighton Canal, North Cave Beck, Ellerker Beck, Mill Beck

items.message: High river levels may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible over the next several days. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near Welham Bridge. The forecast remains unsettled this week. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 09PM on 03rd December 2025 or as the situation changes.

The Flood Warning has now been removed. However, a Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area, so flooding of roads and low lying land is still possible. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

High river levels are expected to continue to cause flooding in Buttercrambe today Wednesday 03 December 2025. Locations most affected will be Buttercrambe Mill at Buttercrambe Bridge. Levels are peaking and will fall marginally tomorrow. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 04:00PM on 03 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible over the next several days. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers, especially land around Barmston. The forecast remains unsettled this week. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 9PM on 03 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Derwent at Stamford Bridge - The Weir Caravan Park and Kexby Bridge

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, North Yorkshire

items.message: High river levels are expected to cause flooding today, Wednesday 03 December 2025. Locations most affected will be riverside footpaths and low-lying land and property in Stamford Bridge, including the Weir Caravan Park. The forecast remains unsettled this week. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Please activate your flood plan. This message will be updated by 04:00PM on 03 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Minor Watercourses from Heighington to Dunston
items.message: High river levels on Wednesday may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 3rd December 2025. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Our forecasts indicate that flooding to properties isn't likely and therefore flood warnings are not expected to be issued. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 11:00am on Thursday, 4th December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Holderness Drain at Wawne Common and Woody Carr

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, Kingston upon Hull

items.message: High river levels are expected to cause flooding today.  Flooding is expected today, Wednesday 03 December 2025.   Properties most affected include areas around Wawne Common, Woody Carr and North's Bridge. We are closely monitoring the situation and have pumps in operation in the area. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 04:00PM on 03 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Holderness Drain and Leven Drain at Leven
items.message: High river levels are expected to cause flooding today.  Flooding is expected today, Wednesday 03 December 2025.  Locations most affected will be Leven village. We are closely monitoring the situation and have pumps in operation in the area. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 04:00PM on 03 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Holderness Drain and Leven Drain in Leven village
items.message: High river levels are expected to cause flooding today, Wednesday 03 December 2025. Locations most affected will be Leven village. The forecast remains unsettled this week. We are closely monitoring the situation and have pumps in operation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Please activate your flood plan if you have one. This message will be updated by 04:00PM on 03 December 2025 or as the situation changes.
